private_information: I control a manipulator that executes a sequence of unstack and stack actions.
I can hold at most one block at a time.
worker1.goal: Execute my assigned block manipulation steps and report the resulting local state changes.

private_information: I control a manipulator that can pickup and putdown blocks and perform stack and unstack actions.
I can hold at most one block at a time.
worker2.goal: Execute my assigned block manipulation steps and report the resulting local state changes.

private_information: I integrate observations from both workers and produce a final PDDL domain and problem for the FastDownwards solver.
orchestrator.goal: Collect the workers' observations and produce a complete PDDL domain and problem describing the initial and final block arrangements suitable for FastDownwards.

public_information: Blocks present: A B C D E F G H.
Standard BlocksWorld rules apply: only the top block of a stack can be moved and only one block can be carried at a time.
Initial arrangement: A is on G.
Initial arrangement: B is on the table.
Initial arrangement: C is on H.
Initial arrangement: D is on F.
Initial arrangement: E is on B.
Initial arrangement: F is on the table.
Initial arrangement: G is on the table.
Initial arrangement: H is on E.
Sequence of executed actions in order: 1. unstack(D,F) 2. stack(D,C) 3. unstack(A,G) 4. stack(A,F) 5. unstack(A,F) 6. stack(A,D) 7. pickup(F) 8. putdown(F) 9. unstack(A,D) 10. stack(A,F).
Derived final arrangement: A is on F. B is on the table. C is on H. D is on C. E is on B. F is on the table. G is on the table. H is on E.

unstack_D_F.system_prompt: You are worker1, an operator performing BlocksWorld moves and reporting observations. Do not emit PDDL. Report the immediate change caused by the action and the local resulting relations between relevant blocks.
unstack_D_F.prompt: Action to execute: unstack D from F. Use the public initial arrangement and your private capabilities to state what block was picked up and which blocks become clear or changed. Provide a concise observation describing the new relation for D and F.

stack_D_C.system_prompt: You are worker1, an operator performing BlocksWorld moves and reporting observations. Do not emit PDDL. Report the immediate change caused by the action and the local resulting relations between relevant blocks.
stack_D_C.prompt: Action to execute: stack D onto C. State the placement result and any changes to block clear-ness in a concise observation.

unstack_A_G.system_prompt: You are worker1, an operator performing BlocksWorld moves and reporting observations. Do not emit PDDL. Report the immediate change caused by the action and the local resulting relations between relevant blocks.
unstack_A_G.prompt: Action to execute: unstack A from G. Report which block is now held and how G's top status changes.

stack_A_F.system_prompt: You are worker1, an operator performing BlocksWorld moves and reporting observations. Do not emit PDDL. Report the immediate change caused by the action and the local resulting relations between relevant blocks.
stack_A_F.prompt: Action to execute: stack A onto F. Report the new relation and any changes to F.

unstack_A_F.system_prompt: You are worker1, an operator performing BlocksWorld moves and reporting observations. Do not emit PDDL. Report the immediate change caused by the action and the local resulting relations between relevant blocks.
unstack_A_F.prompt: Action to execute: unstack A from F. Report which block is held and what becomes clear.

stack_A_D.system_prompt: You are worker2, an operator performing BlocksWorld moves and reporting observations. Do not emit PDDL. Report the immediate change caused by the action and the local resulting relations between relevant blocks.
stack_A_D.prompt: Action to execute: stack A onto D. Report the placement result and local changes.

pickup_F.system_prompt: You are worker2, an operator performing BlocksWorld moves and reporting observations. Do not emit PDDL. Report the immediate change caused by the action and the local resulting relations between relevant blocks.
pickup_F.prompt: Action to execute: pickup F from the table. Report which block is now held and the new status of the table position.

putdown_F.system_prompt: You are worker2, an operator performing BlocksWorld moves and reporting observations. Do not emit PDDL. Report the immediate change caused by the action and the local resulting relations between relevant blocks.
putdown_F.prompt: Action to execute: putdown F on the table. Report the final placement and any local changes.

unstack_A_D.system_prompt: You are worker2, an operator performing BlocksWorld moves and reporting observations. Do not emit PDDL. Report the immediate change caused by the action and the local resulting relations between relevant blocks.
unstack_A_D.prompt: Action to execute: unstack A from D. Report which block is now held and the effect on D.

stack_A_F.system_prompt: You are worker2, an operator performing BlocksWorld moves and reporting observations. Do not emit PDDL. Report the immediate change caused by the action and the local resulting relations between relevant blocks.
stack_A_F.prompt: Action to execute: stack A onto F. Report the final placement and any changes to F.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent BlocksWorld modeling and PDDL for the FastDownwards planner. Produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that represent the BlocksWorld initial state and the derived final arrangement. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Target the FastDownwards solver; use standard STRIPS style predicates for blocks and table relations and include clear and on-table predicates as needed.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Using the public initial arrangement and the observations from the workers, produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for FastDownwards that encode the initial state and the final arrangement. The final arrangement to encode is: A on F, B on the table, C on H, D on C, E on B, F on the table, G on the table, H on E. Keep agent actions distinct if you model multi-agent actions, otherwise produce a single-agent domain modeling the block relations. Enclose the PDDL domain in <domain></domain> and the PDDL problem in <problem></problem>.
